text: is there an easy way to collect data from HDF5 (created using pandas) into a DataFrame?

elements.text: is there an easy way to collect data from HDF5 (created using pandas) into a DataFrame?

text: I guess it depends on how pandas stores/structures the data in the HDF file.  As an aside, I find interoperability with Python through HDF file constructs to be a bit annoying.  One HDF5 file format that I'm working with uses an HDF5 enum type to store booleans, apparently due to how numpy stores bools in HDF5.  Strings are another area where the Python side seems to be a bit persnickety.  I'm not sure if these things are applicable in general or just specific to this particular HDF5 file format.
